qas.question: Where is the Cathedral of Santa Maria Assunta?
When were the mosaics in the Cathedral of Santa Maria Assunta built?
Where is the Basilica of Santi Maria e Donato located?
Who purchased the 13th century mosaic from the the San Cipriano Church?
Where did Frederick William IV relocate the mural he purchased?

context: Other important Venetian mosaics can be found in the Cathedral of Santa Maria Assunta in <a0_0>Torcello<a0_0/> from <a1_0>the 12th century<a1_0/>, and in the Basilical of Santi Maria e Donato in <a2_0>Murano<a2_0/> with a restored apse mosaic from the 12th century and a beautiful mosaic pavement (1140). The apse of the San Cipriano Church in Murano was decorated with an impressive golden mosaic from the early 13th century showing Christ enthroned with Mary, St John and the two patron saints, Cipriano and Cipriana. When the church was demolished in the 19th century, the mosaic was bought by <a3_0>Frederick William IV of Prussia<a3_0/>. It was reassembled in <a4_0>the Friedenskirche of Potsdam<a4_0/> in the 1840s.
